q: The Earth is made up of __________ water and __________ land.
__________ % of the world's water supply is seawater.
__________ % of the world's water supply is usable freshwater.
__________ % of the world's freshwater is frozen in polar ice caps.
__________ % of the world's water supply is groundwater.
__________ systems are diverse set of inland freshwater habitats that include ponds and lakes.
__________ are distinct ecosystems that are flooded by water, either permanently or seasonally, where oxygen-free processes prevail.
__________ systems include all running water habitats such as rivers and streams.
The molecular structure of water is represented as __________.
Water is a good __________ due to its polar nature.
Water has a high heat of __________.
Water has a high heat __________.
Water has a relatively high surface __________.
Water is the only natural substance that __________ when it freezes.
Water is most dense at __________ °C.
Water can __________ into H+ and OH- ions.
The process by which solvent molecules surround and interact with solute ions or molecules is called __________.
Earth is a __________ system: Rarely loses or gains matter.
Humans use about __________ % of reliable runoff for various purposes.
The weight lost directly after intense physical activity is weight from __________ not fat.
__________ is an essential resource that can be considered both renewable and non-renewable.
Drinking contaminated water can lead to __________ diseases.
In the Philippines, almost __________ million Filipinos do not have a sustainable source of potable water.
__________ million Filipinos do not have access to sanitation facilities.
Only __________ % of the country's water demands are being met in the Philippines.
Water quality can be determined by __________, chemical, and biological characteristics.
__________ is a measure of the light-transmitting properties of water.
__________ (TDS) refers to inorganic salts and small amounts of organic matter present in solution in water.
__________ - Amount of gaseous oxygen (O2) dissolved in an aqueous solution
__________ Oxygen Demand (BOD) is widely used as an indication of the organic quality of water.
__________ coliform bacteria is a common measure of biological pollution in water.
Species that provide an indication as to the quality of the water based on their ability to survive in it are referred to as __________ indicators.
An average household consumes __________ m³ of water per month.
__________ Dam in Bulacan supplies 76% of Manila's water needs.
The __________ Pay Principle is applied in environmental laws for water resource protection.
PD 984 - 1974 is also known as the __________ Law.
Water conservation methods include reducing losses due to __________, improving irrigation efficiency, and using water-efficient appliances.
'Gray' water reuse requires __________ treatment depending on effluent quality.
Installing __________ toilets is a method of domestic water conservation.
The __________ system is a water-saving method used in some households.
Major environmental issues related to water include water pollution, lack of water treatment and sanitation, and water __________.
